sentences.sContent: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.sCn: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

words.tran: 失望的，沮丧的；受挫折的
令人失望的；令人扫兴的
令人失望（disappoint的ing形式）；辜负…的期望

remMethod.val: dis(没有)+appoint(委任) →没有受到委任→使失望

trans.tranOther: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected
